moves.1. e4: My favorite: King Pawn, although I played it differently to how I play it now.
moves.2. Nf3 d6 3. Nc3: Following the classical opening principle: Knights before bishops.
moves.3... Nc6 4. Be2 Nf6: All four knights have been developed early.
moves.7. d3: Blocking in the bishop. See why I do King Pawn differently now?
moves.7... a6 8. a4 b6: Unusual, I would've castled by now. This also weakens the a6 pawn, unless the bishop doesn't develop.
moves.10... exd5 11. Bd2: Or else: d4 forking knight and bishop.
moves.13. Nxd4 cxd4 14. Na2: My only safe square except for b1.
moves.14... a5 15. c3: Wanting my knight back where he wants to be.
moves.18. b4 axb4 19. Nxb4: Now my knight is back in the action.
moves.19... Bb7 20. d4 Bd6 21. Bb5: Looking for any possibilities of an attack.
moves.23... Nxd2 24. Qxd2 h6 25. Rab1 Qg5: ? Why would he do this, I love swapping queens, and he's doubling pawns.
moves.26. Qxg5 hxg5 27. Na2: My knight wants his c3 square back.
moves.28. Bxc6 Rxc6 29. Rec1: Wanting to swap, but I should be trying to exploit his missing h-pawn weakness, if I could get both rooks there…
moves.29... Rcc8: Wanting to still own the file, I guess.
moves.31... Rc4 32. Rxc4 dxc4 33. Kf1: Now begins the race of the kings.
moves.33... Kf8 34. Ke2 Ke7 35. Kd2 Ke6 36. Nc: At first, I thought of Kc3, But I think this is better.
moves.36... Bb4 37. Kc2 f5 38. g3: I don't want black in my territory.
moves.40... Kc6 41. h4 Bxc3 42. Kxc3: The knight for bishop swap was better for me.
moves.42... b5: ? Now after axb5+ Kxb5 h5 Ka4 a5 a6 b6 or c6, I win the c4 pawn.
moves.45... Kd6 46. d5 Ke7 47. Kc5: At this point I am going for the queen with only my pawn and king.
moves.47... Kd7 48. d6 Kd8 49. Kc6: Somewhere around this point, my opponent offers a draw. NO WAY!!
moves.49... Kc8 50. Kd5 Kd7 51. Ke5: This is where I change my mind and go for the f5 and g7 pawns, and then I want to queen.
My opponent resigns, there is nothing to stop me from queening my h-pawn from queening. Thanks for reading, and thanks for the game James!
